newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian shares ease as investors mull dividends. [CORRECTED 16:35 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian shares ease as investors mull dividends. [CORRECTED 16:35 GMT]

text.p: Lithuanian shares eased in light trade on Wednesday as investors mulled low dividends and waited for the results from a spate of shareholders' meetings, dealers said.
The Lintin A index fell 17.91 points to 2,587.41 in central market trade of 1.8 million litas.
Trade in several companies has been suspended pending shareholders' meetings and dealers said investors were holding their breath waiting for the outcomes.
"Prices seem to have stabilized, but these meetings will have an impact on share prices," Robertas Birzinskas of Vilniaus Bank's brokerage company told Reuters.
"Investors are a bit hesitant right now because dividends have not been very high, even on shares from companies with good profits," said Arvydas Kvietkauskas of Hermis Bank's brokerage firm.
"Even Vilniaus Bank's proposed dividends are not so high despite its good results," he said.
Vilniaus Bank announced on Monday that it planned to retain most of its 24.4 million litas 1996 net profit within the company.
Vilniaus Bank's ordinary shares were one of the session's casualties, falling almost ten percent to 234.00 litas in light trade of only 4,680 litas.
Its preferential shares were unchanged at 1,600 litas and turned over 46,400 litas.
Hermis Bank's shares were unchanged at 190.00 litas in relatively high demand, turning over almost 522,000 litas.
Lithuania Gas rose to 2.37 litas from 2.35 litas in trade of almost 276,000 litas. (Corrects share movement)
Block trades turned over only 68,000 litas.
